questions.question: The company has turned the ................................. and its prospects are looking up.
questions.description: To turn a / the corner is to pass a critical situation.

questions.question: He cleverly turned the ........................................ on his opponent.
questions.description: To turn the tables is to turn a position of disadvantage to one of advantage.

questions.question: He is a short tempered guy but his ...................................... is in the right place.
questions.description: To have your heart in the right place is to have the right intentions.

questions.question: The problem of unemployment is a hard ......................................... to crack.
questions.description: A hard nut to crack is a difficult problem.

questions.question: He found himself in .......................................... water over his comments about the prophet.
questions.description: To find yourself in hot water is to be in a difficult situation.

questions.question: Scientists searching for life on other planets may be on a ............................................... chase.
questions.description: A wild goose chase is a foolish and hopeless search.

questions.question: Once he became an established writer, he was content to rest on his ...................................
questions.description: To rest on one's oars is to stop working after achieving success or finishing a task.

questions.question: The player was nursing an injury and it took the ........................................ out his sails.
questions.description: To take the wind out of sails is to cause someone to lose energy or confidence.

questions.question: The manager took him to ........................................ for not meeting the deadlines.
questions.description: To take somebody to task is to reprimand them.

questions.question: The police left no ...................................... unturned in their search for the missing boy.
questions.description: To leave no stone unturned is to do everything possible.
